title: Guest List for State of the Union Includes Epstein Victims, Erika Kirk and U.S. Olympic Hockey Players
summary: Democratic lawmakers invited victims of Jeffrey Epstein and of President Trump’s aggressive immigration crackdown.

title: How The New York Times Covers the SOTU Under Intense Deadline Pressure
summary: The editor who oversees White House coverage for The Times talks about the challenges of tracking a major speech by a president who regularly goes off script.

title: House Narrowly Rejects Air Safety Bill After Pentagon Opposition
summary: A move to swiftly pass the bill failed by a single vote. It would have required aircraft to carry technology that officials said might have prevented a midair collision near Washington last year.

title: Pentagon Gives Anthropic an Ultimatum Over the Company’s A.I. Model
summary: Anthropic insists on limits on how its technology is used and could be labeled a supply chain risk if it fails to accept the military’s demands.

title: Mexico Is Caught Between Trump and the Cartels
summary: President Trump has demanded President Claudia Sheinbaum confront the cartels. The killing of El Mencho suggests it might be working — but could come at a cost.

title: What to Know About the Cartels Operating in Mexico
summary: Other criminal groups in Mexico may try to take advantage of the death of Nemesio Oseguera Cervantes, also known as El Mencho, who ran the Jalisco New Generation Cartel.

title: Is It Safe to Travel to Mexico Right Now, Given the Cartel Violence?
summary: A wave of unrest after the killing of a cartel leader has rattled tourists in Mexico, prompting travelers to reconsider their plans. Here’s what to know.

title: Snowball Fight in New York Turns Chaotic After Police Arrive
summary: Police Commissioner Jessica Tisch said officers had been attacked at Washington Square Park. Mayor Zohran Mamdani said the episode looked like a snowball fight, not a crime.

title: Providence, R.I. Digs Out From Three Feet of Snow
summary: A day after the city got a record-breaking amount of snow, some residents clung to the magic. Others were gearing up for endless shoveling.

title: Blizzard Causes Major Airport Delays and Cancellations: What Travelers Should Know
summary: As major hubs in the Northeast dig out from up to three feet of snow, it could be days before some travelers get moving. Here’s where things stand.

title: The U.S. Men’s Hockey Team Has Arrived in Washington
summary: Two gold medal-winning U.S. hockey teams were invited to Washington for the State of the Union address. Only one came to town.

title: D.O.J. Sues U.C.L.A. After It Refused to Pay $1 Billion Fine
summary: The Trump administration accused the university’s Los Angeles campus of not doing enough to curb antisemitism, months after the government tried to cut research money and demanded more than $1 billion.

title: Trump’s New Tariffs Could Face Legal Challenges
summary: Critics are questioning the legality of the provision President Trump has used to replace his previous slate of tariffs, raising the prospect of yet another legal battle.

title: How Jeffrey Epstein Ingratiated Himself With Top Microsoft Executives
summary: For more than two decades, the convicted sex offender developed a network at the tech giant, making him privy to succession discussions and other business.

title: After Being Shoved in Front of a Train, He Has Returned to the Subway
summary: Joseph Lynskey was determined to overcome his fear and reclaim his life as a New Yorker who enjoys the city in full. On Tuesday, he filed a lawsuit against the city and the M.T.A.

title: How the Flood Fractured the Tightknit Camp Mystic Community
summary: The camp has been the foundation of an invisible network of status and power in Texas. Now, following the flood, that social web is beginning to fray.

title: Ukraine Battlefield Dead Could Reach 500,000 in Fifth Year, Estimates Suggest
summary: Russia has lost as many as 325,000 troops, according to some estimates, with more than 200,000 deaths verified by researchers.

title: Study Shows Xi’s Purges of China’s Military Run Deep
summary: Around 100 senior officers have been sidelined or vanished since 2022, hollowing out the top ranks and raising questions about the army’s capabilities.

title: Germany’s Leader Heads to China and Walks a Tightrope Between Xi and Trump
summary: Chancellor Friedrich Merz’s trip will test his ability to address tensions between the countries, at a time of strain between Europe and Washington.

title: After a Big Loss, What to Expect From Trump at the State of the Union
summary: The Supreme Court’s tariffs ruling could make for a tense night.

title: John Roberts Is Losing Patience With Trump
summary: How to read the gratuitous paragraph in the chief justice’s tariff opinion.

title: Trump Will Deliver His State of the Union Address
summary: Also, most teens use A.I. chatbots for schoolwork. Here’s the latest at the end of Tuesday.

title: Paramount Raises Its Bid for Warner Bros. Discovery
summary: Warner Bros. Discovery said Paramount’s new offer of $31 a share could lead to a “superior proposal” to the deal it signed with Netflix.

title: Judge Dismisses Minnesota Gun Case as Prosecutors Struggle With Resignations
summary: A judge took the unusual step of dropping the case over a speedy trial violation by the U.S. attorney’s office in Minnesota, which has been flooded with immigration-related cases.

title: Éliane Radigue, Composer of Time, Silence and Space, Dies at 94
summary: Her Tibetan Buddhist spiritual practice and her experiments with synthesizers came together in vast, slow-moving works that drew wide acclaim.

title: ‘Abolish ICE’ Wins Chicago’s Snowplow Naming Contest
summary: An annual contest usually draws lighthearted quips. This year, Chicagoans chose a political pun.
